column2: kereta (means carriage in Indonesian, commonly used as a shorthand for kereta api, which means train. Malay followed English derivation of car which was a contraction of horseless carriage)

column3: 1. kasir, from Dutch kassier 2. juru uang (rare)
sensus, cacah, banci (virtually never used in Indonesia, listed by KBBI)

column2: cili, lada ('pepper' in Indonesian, also in Malaysian[33]), cabai (used in the northern states of Malaysia)

column3: 1. Tionghoa (standard term for Chinese people, from Southern Min Chinese: Tiong-hôa – ??), 2. Tiongkok (Republik Rakyat Tiongkok and Republik Tiongkok: official name of the People's Republic of China and Republic of China, from Southern Min Chinese: Tiong-kok – ??), 3. Cina (standard, still in common use but discouraged due to racist connotations. See Shina for further information.), 4. China (nonstandard)

column2: panggung wayang bergambar (more popularly abbreviated as pawagam), panggung wayang

column3: kota, bandar (a coastal or port city in Indonesian)

column2: klarifikasi, penjelasan, penjernihan (to make something, e.g. water, clear in Indonesian)
fasal (equivalent term in Indonesian is pasal)

column3: lipas, kecoa (from Southern Min Chinese: ka-choa?h – ??)

column2: syiling from English shilling siling from English shilling (rare) mata wang, wang logam, duit from Dutch duit[35]
column3: koin, mata uang, uang logam duit from Dutch duit[36][37]
ulasan (can also mean review, interpretation or comment), komentar (from Dutch commentaar)
perusahaan, firma, maskapai (from Dutch maatschappij – almost exclusively used to refer to airline companies, i.e. maskapai penerbangan)
konfirmasi, pengesahan of a document, kepastian of a decision
undang-undang dasar (influenced by Dutch grondwet (basic law"))
pembangunan (of building), pembinaan (of moral), konstruksi (from Dutch constructie)
korporasi (from Dutch corporatie), badan usaha, perusahaan
korupsi (from Dutch corruptie), rasuah (from Arabic: Rashwah meaning 'bribe')(non-standard)
negara, negeri in Malaysia, negeri usually refers to a state within a federation
penjahat, kriminal, pidana (ahli pidana is criminal law expert)
saat ini, kini, terkini, aktual (from Dutch actueel)

column2: langsir (means train wagon arrangement in Indonesian), tirai
column3: tirai (used for all meanings apart from house curtain), gorden (of a house; from Dutch gordijn)
pabean refers to the administrative institution, bea dan cukai (bea-cukai) lit. tariff-and-tax, duty
air keran (from Dutch Kraan), air ledeng (ledeng" also means "plumbing"

column2: ubi kayu as in Indonesian, understood as the tuber cassava itself
ustaz, ustad (ultimately from Persian ???????), ustadzah female
pasukan used in Indonesian to refer to squad (military)

column3: testis, biji kemaluan, buah zakar (slang, vulgar), kanjut (slang, vulgar)
Thailand, Siam, Muangthai used in old scripts
tiket, karcis (from Dutch kaartje, usually refers to small-size ticket)
waktu from Arabic ????? (al-Waqt), masa (can be used for 'in a specific long period of time' in Indonesian)
toilet, kamar kecil, WC (pronounced 'way-say') for watercloset

column2: lampu isyarat (In Indonesian, isyarat means sign)

column3: transportasi, pengangkutan, perhubungan (in case of Ministry of Transportation)
transseksual, waria (polite) a shortened form of wanita-pria , bencong, banci

column2: pokok in Indonesian means principal" or "core" or "staple"

column3: trilyun, triliun (from Dutch pronunciation; starting with 1012, Indonesian uses the short scale)

column2: pusing (means 'to spin' in Indonesian, commonly used to mean dizzy as a short form of kepala pusing), belok
